pattern.title: Validate METS element fileSec.

rule.assert: When the section is used only one file section (fileSec) element is present. It is possible to transfer just descriptive metadata and/or adminsitrative metadata without files placed in this section.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element id

rule.assert: An identifier for the file section used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package. The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CSIP named "General requirements for the use of metadata".

pattern.title: Validate METS file element fileGrp.

rule.assert: There are one or more file group (fileGrp) elements present grouping the transfered files in the main catagorization of; Documentation, Schemas and Representations. In one or more file groups with the catagorization of "Documentation" all documetation pertaining to the transfered information is present. In one or more file groups with the catagorization of "Schemas" all XML-schemas pertaining to the transfered XML documents is present. In one or more file groups with the catagorization of "Representations" the data being transfered is present or in one file group the data for each representation is present. To make the catagorization easier the different files being transfered should be placed in folders with names folowing the catagorization .

pattern.title: Validate METS file element admid

rule.assert: If administrative metadata is has been provided on the file group (fileGrp) level this attribute points to the correct administrative metadata section.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element contentinformationtype

rule.assert: An added attribute which describes the specific content information type specification used for the transferred content. The attribute is mandatory to use when the file group catagorization is Representations. The vocabulary is going to evolve under the care of the DILCIS Board as additional content information type specifications are developed.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element othercontentinformationtype

rule.assert: When the @csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE uses the value "OTHER" the @csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE must describe the content.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element use

rule.assert: The value in the @USE is the name of the whole folder structure to the data, e.g "Documentation", "Schemas", "Representations/preingest" or "Representations/submission/data".

pattern.title: Validate METS file element grp id

rule.assert: An identifier for the file group used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package. The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CSIP named "General requirements for the use of metadata".

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file.

rule.assert: The lowest level file group (fileGrp) contains the file elements which describe the transferred file objects. When the file element is categorised as "Representations" each representation file group contains one file which is the reference to the METS document describing the representation.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file id

rule.assert: A unique identifier for this file across the package. The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CSIP named "General requirements for the use of metadata".

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file mimetype

rule.assert: The IANA mime type for the linked file.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file size

rule.assert: Size of the linked file in bytes.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file created

rule.assert: Date the linked file was created.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file checksum

rule.assert: The checksum of the linked file.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file checksum type

rule.assert: The type of checksum following the value list in the standard which used for the linked file.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file owner id

rule.assert: If an original ID for the file has been given by the owner it can be saved in this attribute.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file adm id

rule.assert: If administrative metadata has been described for the file this attribute points to the file's administrative metadata.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file dmd id

rule.assert: If descriptive metadata has been described per file this attribute points to the file's descriptive metadata.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file Flocat.

rule.assert: The location of each external file must be defined by the file location (FLocat) element using the same rules as for referencing metadata files. All references to files should be made using the XLink href attribute and the file protocol using the relative location of the file.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file flocat loctype

rule.assert: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file flocat type

rule.assert: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

pattern.title: Validate METS file element file flocat href

rule.assert: The actual location of the resource. We recommend recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.
